result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Louis Hammer

records.addlTxt:
9:02 AM Defendant Chad Louis Hammer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Chad Louis Hammer.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf for Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. State has made offer and requests another status. Attorney Hoffman asks for another status conference in 2-4 weeks.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No contact with Victim 1 or their residence.

3:34 PM Defendant Chad Louis Hammer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Chad Louis Hammer.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Hoffman argues not able to post in this matter. Very limited funds, indigent. Resident of Duluth for last 25 years.  Requests $100 cash and $1000 signature bond.
State opposes modification. Only 11 days have elapsed since initial appearance. This is a violation of bond conditions in another file. Cites number of priors but no FTA's. 
Court makes statements. Court orders $2000 signature bond with current conditions to continue which is no contact with Victim 1.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification

Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
No contact with victim 1 as listed in ID key or their residence.
also $250 cash bail.

No contact with victim 1 as listed in ID key or their residence.
also $1000 signature bond

1:28 PM Defendant Chad Louis Hammer appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Michael Hoffman via video.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Not guilty plea(s) entered. 
State requesting $500cb No contact with victim 1 or their residence. Based on  nature of the offense; violation bond conditions by having contact with victim 1 while out on bond.
Attorney Hoffman indicates resided at address for 15 years, has lived in the are for a substantial amount of time.  Family ties in Duluth, prior military service. Does not believe he's on probation or parole anywhere else. Financial means extremely limited; cannot post over $100.
Court cites concerns; nature of the charges indicates unable to follow court orders
Court orders $250 cb and $1000sb No contact with victim 1 as listed in ID key or their residence.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
